reasoning:

**Hand Levels:**

**Possible Hands I can make:**
Looking at my hand:

- Also: Queens and 8s (Spades & Diamonds) = Two Pair
- Pair of Queens: 3, 5
- Pair of Jacks: 4, 8
- Pair of 8s: 2, 10

I don't have a Full House available in my current hand, which is my strongest hand type. I can form two different Two Pair combinations, but no stronger poker hands. Let me evaluate playing Two Pair now versus discarding to find better options.

Playing Two Pair (Queens + Jacks) with the Blue Joker would score around 1,030 chipsâ€”far short of the 16,500 needed. Alternatively, I could discard cards hoping to draw into a Full House, which would be significantly more powerful at Level 6. The deck still has three tens, two Queens, and multiple Kings, Aces, and 2s available. Since I already have two Queens and two Jacks, drawing a third Queen or Jack would complete a Full House, which is a much stronger hand type than Two Pair. I should discard the cards that don't contribute to my pairs. The 10 of Spades, 5 of Clubs, 3 of Clubs, and 9 of Diamonds are all singletons, so I'll get rid of those and keep my three pairs intact. Drawing four new cards gives me a solid chance at hitting a third card in one of my ranks to complete the Full House.
